{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3521440,"name":"","username":"jacob_mazelin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacob_mazelin/{size}/213574_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-09T17:13:44.782Z","cooked":"

Hey everyone,

My team is using PathPlanner for autonomous paths and a Limelight for pose estimation. I want our autonomous routines to start from wherever the robot is actually positioned at the beginning of the match instead of assuming the first waypoint’s position from PathPlanner.

Right now, if we accidentally misalign the robot when setting up, the auto tries to correct itself to the first PathPlanner waypoint before continuing the path. Instead, I want it to immediately follow the path from wherever it starts without adjusting to the predefined first waypoint.

Current Issue (Video Link)

  • If the robot’s starting pose does not match the first waypoint in PathPlanner, it corrects itself to that waypoint first.
  • I want it to ignore the first waypoint’s position and just start the path from its current location and drive to the end pose.

Questions:

  1. Is there a built-in PathPlanner feature to ignore the starting position in the GUI and use the robot’s actual pose instead?
  2. Has anyone successfully made auto paths dynamically start from the robot’s actual pose?

You might be looking for PathPlanners “PathFinding” which generates a path from an arbitrary starting and ending pose.

https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-pathfinding.html

The 2024 Version had a checkbox to ignore starting position. So if you were rotated from ideal it would still path correctly.
I’m not seeing that in 2025…

If you are using autos, you can tell it to not reset the odometery with a checkbox!

If you are just using paths you’ll need to look into the docs for what variables / methods you can use to modify how the paths work.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-09T21:04:37.761Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":75.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":490894,"topic_slug":"adjusting-pathplanner-paths-to-start-at-robots-current-position","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/adjusting-pathplanner-paths-to-start-at-robots-current-position/490894/4","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3521612,"name":"Andrew J (FRC 2881)","username":"mythgarr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mythgarr/{size}/238053_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-09T21:31:24.990Z","cooked":"

Make sure you’re calling followPath, not pathfindAndFollowPath (don’t have the exact method names in front of me, sorry). Followpath will compensate for a small amount of error from the initial pose through the PID controller, pathfind will go to the starting point first before following the path.

If you are trying to generate an auto alignment path (based on the video this looks like what you are trying to do?).I’d recommend not using a premade path, instead I’d recommend generating the path on the fly.

We (4915) have successfully made our own implementation of this for automatically aligning to reef.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-09T22:41:24.305Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":490894,"topic_slug":"adjusting-pathplanner-paths-to-start-at-robots-current-position","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-create-a-path-on-the-fly.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Create a Path On-the-fly | PathPlanner Docs","clicks":42}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/adjusting-pathplanner-paths-to-start-at-robots-current-position/490894/6","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3522127,"name":"","username":"jacob_mazelin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacob_mazelin/{size}/213574_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T13:21:38.893Z","cooked":"

We implemented Pathplanner’s PathfindtoPose method to align with the reef instead of generating a path on the fly. In my mind, they both do the same thing, but do you know if there are any advantages to either of them? Is one of them faster or more accurate or are they pretty much the same?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-10T13:21:38.893Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":490894,"topic_slug":"adjusting-pathplanner-paths-to-start-at-robots-current-position","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63596,"username":"Otter502","name":"Val","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57331,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5675 Team Captain"},"post_url":"/t/adjusting-pathplanner-paths-to-start-at-robots-current-position/490894/7","custom_user_title":"5675 Team Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3522129,"name":"","username":"jacob_mazelin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacob_mazelin/{size}/213574_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T13:23:55.063Z","cooked":"

We will uncheck the checkbox and see what changes. I think this might fix our issue with Pathplanner trying to go to the start of the path first instead of starting the path at it’s current location. Thanks for the tip!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-10T13:23:55.063Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":127,"readers_count":126,"score":30.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":490894,"topic_slug":"adjusting-pathplanner-paths-to-start-at-robots-current-position","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63596,"username":"Otter502","name":"Val","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57331,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5675 Team Captain"},"post_url":"/t/adjusting-pathplanner-paths-to-start-at-robots-current-position/490894/8","custom_user_title":"5675 Team Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3522217,"name":"Val","username":"Otter502","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T15:34:12.882Z","cooked":"

The docs specifically say that pathfinding shouldn’t be used for alignment.
The way that we implemented the on the fly path generation let’s us handle the bot in motion smoothly, it’s fairly fast / Accurate too!

Can someone clear up how to add an implementation of either the crate a Path on the fly or Path finding to the start of a pre-planned path?

Currently, my programming team is doing a great job constructing complex auto using linked waypoints and named commands from the GUI interface. We are seeing some jumps at the start of many of the middle paths, likely due to the auto align commands that run parallel to scoring,g moving the theoretical start point.

We have tested the chained paths with no interrupted movements between them and have received great results, leading us to believe there must be a better way.
